issue.title: feat: Add MCP server

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: feature
labels.description: This change adds a new feature to ESLint

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

issue.body:
<!--
    Thank you for contributing!

    ESLint adheres to the [OpenJS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://eslint.org/conduct).
-->

#### Prerequisites checklist

-   [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

<!--
    The following template is intentionally not a markdown checkbox list for the reasons
    explained in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/12848#issuecomment-580302888
-->

[ ] Documentation update
[ ] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofix to a rule
[x] Add a CLI option
[ ] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

<!--
    If the item you've checked above has a template, please paste the template questions below and answer them. (If this pull request is addressing an issue, you can just paste a link to the issue here instead.)
-->

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/latest/contribute/pull-requests)
    - Include tests for this change
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

This change adds an MCP server that is triggered by `--mcp`. Because no other options are valid with this, I implemented it similar to `--init`.

The TypeScript SDK is a bit rough, so I had to work around a couple of things. Overall, everything works. You can test it out locally using the MCP inspector:
https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/inspector

fixes #19588

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

<!-- markdownlint-disable-file MD004 -->

body: Do any other tools provide an `--mcp` flag? I tried running [a quick search](https://github.com/search?q=%2F--mcp%28%5Cs%7C%24%29%2F&type=code) on GitHub but didn't find any great results.
No. Most MCP servers are standalone tools, which I don't think is appropriate for ESLint. It makes more sense to just leverage the existing CLI in case we want to support other flags in the future.

That's a really interesting topic. I was just thinking about this. My idea was, that this might help AI tools understand issues in the code better and help to fix things that can't be fixed by the linter itself. But this would mean that the MCP Server needs to provide information about the rule and possibly link to the documentation to be able to solve this.

> My idea was, that this might help AI tools understand issues in the code better and help to fix things that can't be fixed by the linter itself. But this would mean that the MCP Server needs to provide information about the rule and possibly link to the documentation to be able to solve this.

Thanks for the suggestion @DaSchTour. We can extend the amount of information provided by the server in subsequent iterations.

Yeah, I think we need to get something shipped for people to play with and give us feedback. Then we can see where to go from there.

The nice thing about MCP is that we don't need to worry about changing the output format of tools because there's no strict contract there. We can always add more info later.
